speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: SCENE II. Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Enter BAPTISTA, VINCENTIO, GREMIO, the Pedant,  LUCENTIO, BIANCA, PETRUCHIO, KATHARINA, HORTENSIO,  and Widow, TRANIO, BIONDELLO, and GRUMIO the Serving-men with Tranio bringing in a banquet

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: At last, though long, our jarring notes agree:

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: And time it is, when raging war is done,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: To smile at scapes and perils overblown.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: My fair Bianca, bid my father welcome,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: While I with self-same kindness welcome thine.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: Brother Petruchio, sister Katharina,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: And thou, Hortensio, with thy loving widow,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: Feast with the best, and welcome to my house:

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: My banquet is to close our stomachs up,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: After our great good cheer. Pray you, sit down;

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: For now we sit to chat as well as eat.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Nothing but sit and sit, and eat and eat!

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: Padua affords this kindness, son Petruchio.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Padua affords nothing but what is kind.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: For both our sakes, I would that word were true.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Now, for my life, Hortensio fears his widow.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Then never trust me, if I be afeard.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: You are very sensible, and yet you miss my sense:

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: I mean, Hortensio is afeard of you.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: He that is giddy thinks the world turns round.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Roundly replied.

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Mistress, how mean you that?

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Thus I conceive by him.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Conceives by me! How likes Hortensio that?

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: My widow says, thus she conceives her tale.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Very well mended. Kiss him for that, good widow.

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: 'He that is giddy thinks the world turns round:'

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: I pray you, tell me what you meant by that.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Your husband, being troubled with a shrew,

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Measures my husband's sorrow by his woe:

speaker: Widow
text_entry: And now you know my meaning,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: A very mean meaning.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Right, I mean you.

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And I am mean indeed, respecting you.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: To her, Kate!

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: To her, widow!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: A hundred marks, my Kate does put her down.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: That's my office.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Spoke like an officer; ha' to thee, lad!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Drinks to HORTENSIO

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: How likes Gremio these quick-witted folks?

speaker: GREMIO
text_entry: Believe me, sir, they butt together well.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Head, and butt! an hasty-witted body

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Would say your head and butt were head and horn.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text_entry: Ay, mistress bride, hath that awaken'd you?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Ay, but not frighted me; therefore I'll sleep again.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Nay, that you shall not: since you have begun,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Have at you for a bitter jest or two!

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Am I your bird? I mean to shift my bush;

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: And then pursue me as you draw your bow.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: You are welcome all.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Exeunt BIANCA, KATHARINA, and Widow

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: She hath prevented me. Here, Signior Tranio.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: This bird you aim'd at, though you hit her not;

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Therefore a health to all that shot and miss'd.

speaker: TRANIO
text_entry: O, sir, Lucentio slipp'd me like his greyhound,

speaker: TRANIO
text_entry: Which runs himself and catches for his master.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: A good swift simile, but something currish.

speaker: TRANIO
text_entry: 'Tis well, sir, that you hunted for yourself:

speaker: TRANIO
text_entry: 'Tis thought your deer does hold you at a bay.

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: O ho, Petruchio! Tranio hits you now.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: I thank thee for that gird, good Tranio.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Confess, confess, hath he not hit you here?

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: A' has a little gall'd me, I confess;

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: And, as the jest did glance away from me,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: 'Tis ten to one it maim'd you two outright.

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: Now, in good sadness, son Petruchio,

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: I think thou hast the veriest shrew of all.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Well, I say no: and therefore for assurance

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Let's each one send unto his wife;

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: And he whose wife is most obedient

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: To come at first when he doth send for her,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Shall win the wager which we will propose.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Content. What is the wager?

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: Twenty crowns.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Twenty crowns!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: I'll venture so much of my hawk or hound,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: But twenty times so much upon my wife.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: A hundred then.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Content.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: A match! 'tis done.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Who shall begin?

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: That will I.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: Go, Biondello, bid your mistress come to me.

speaker: BIONDELLO
text_entry: I go.

speaker: BIONDELLO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: Son, I'll be your half, Bianca comes.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: I'll have no halves; I'll bear it all myself.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: Re-enter BIONDELLO

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: How now! what news?

speaker: BIONDELLO
text_entry: Sir, my mistress sends you word

speaker: BIONDELLO
text_entry: That she is busy and she cannot come.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: How! she is busy and she cannot come!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Is that an answer?

speaker: GREMIO
text_entry: Ay, and a kind one too:

speaker: GREMIO
text_entry: Pray God, sir, your wife send you not a worse.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: I hope better.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Sirrah Biondello, go and entreat my wife

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: To come to me forthwith.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Exit BIONDELLO

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: O, ho! entreat her!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Nay, then she must needs come.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: I am afraid, sir,

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Do what you can, yours will not be entreated.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Re-enter BIONDELLO

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Now, where's my wife?

speaker: BIONDELLO
text_entry: She says you have some goodly jest in hand:

speaker: BIONDELLO
text_entry: She will not come: she bids you come to her.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Worse and worse; she will not come! O vile,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Intolerable, not to be endured!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Sirrah Grumio, go to your mistress;

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Say, I command her to come to me.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Exit GRUMIO

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: I know her answer.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: What?

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: She will not.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: The fouler fortune mine, and there an end.

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: Now, by my holidame, here comes Katharina!

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: Re-enter KATARINA

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: What is your will, sir, that you send for me?

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Where is your sister, and Hortensio's wife?

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: They sit conferring by the parlor fire.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Go fetch them hither: if they deny to come.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Swinge me them soundly forth unto their husbands:

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Away, I say, and bring them hither straight.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Exit KATHARINA

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: Here is a wonder, if you talk of a wonder.

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: And so it is: I wonder what it bodes.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Marry, peace it bodes, and love and quiet life,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: And awful rule and right supremacy;

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: And, to be short, what not, that's sweet and happy?

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: Now, fair befal thee, good Petruchio!

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: The wager thou hast won; and I will add

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: Unto their losses twenty thousand crowns;

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: Another dowry to another daughter,

speaker: BAPTISTA
text_entry: For she is changed, as she had never been.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Nay, I will win my wager better yet

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: And show more sign of her obedience,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Her new-built virtue and obedience.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: See where she comes and brings your froward wives

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: As prisoners to her womanly persuasion.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Re-enter KATHARINA, with BIANCA and Widow

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Katharina, that cap of yours becomes you not:

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Off with that bauble, throw it under-foot.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Lord, let me never have a cause to sigh,

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Till I be brought to such a silly pass!

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Fie! what a foolish duty call you this?

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: I would your duty were as foolish too:

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: The wisdom of your duty, fair Bianca,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: Hath cost me an hundred crowns since supper-time.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: The more fool you, for laying on my duty.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Katharina, I charge thee, tell these headstrong women

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: What duty they do owe their lords and husbands.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Come, come, you're mocking: we will have no telling.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Come on, I say; and first begin with her.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: She shall not.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: I say she shall: and first begin with her.

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Fie, fie! unknit that threatening unkind brow,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And dart not scornful glances from those eyes,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: To wound thy lord, thy king, thy governor:

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: It blots thy beauty as frosts do bite the meads,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Confounds thy fame as whirlwinds shake fair buds,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And in no sense is meet or amiable.

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: A woman moved is like a fountain troubled,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Muddy, ill-seeming, thick, bereft of beauty;

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And while it is so, none so dry or thirsty

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Will deign to sip or touch one drop of it.

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Thy husband is thy lord, thy life, thy keeper,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Thy head, thy sovereign; one that cares for thee,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And for thy maintenance commits his body

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: To painful labour both by sea and land,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: To watch the night in storms, the day in cold,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Whilst thou liest warm at home, secure and safe;

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And craves no other tribute at thy hands

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: But love, fair looks and true obedience;

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Too little payment for so great a debt.

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Such duty as the subject owes the prince

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Even such a woman oweth to her husband;

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And when she is froward, peevish, sullen, sour,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And not obedient to his honest will,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: What is she but a foul contending rebel

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And graceless traitor to her loving lord?

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: I am ashamed that women are so simple

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: To offer war where they should kneel for peace;

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Or seek for rule, supremacy and sway,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: When they are bound to serve, love and obey.

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Why are our bodies soft and weak and smooth,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Unapt to toil and trouble in the world,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: But that our soft conditions and our hearts

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Should well agree with our external parts?

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Come, come, you froward and unable worms!

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: My mind hath been as big as one of yours,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: My heart as great, my reason haply more,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: To bandy word for word and frown for frown;

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: But now I see our lances are but straws,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Our strength as weak, our weakness past compare,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: That seeming to be most which we indeed least are.

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: Then vail your stomachs, for it is no boot,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: And place your hands below your husband's foot:

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: In token of which duty, if he please,

speaker: KATHARINA
text_entry: My hand is ready; may it do him ease.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Why, there's a wench! Come on, and kiss me, Kate.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: Well, go thy ways, old lad; for thou shalt ha't.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text_entry: 'Tis a good hearing when children are toward.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: But a harsh hearing when women are froward.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Come, Kate, we'll to bed.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: We three are married, but you two are sped.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: To LUCENTIO

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: 'Twas I won the wager, though you hit the white;

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: And, being a winner, God give you good night!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text_entry: Exeunt PETRUCHIO and KATHARINA

speaker: HORTENSIO
text_entry: Now, go thy ways; thou hast tamed a curst shrew.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: 'Tis a wonder, by your leave, she will be tamed so.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: Exeunt
